title: Christine McGuinness fears for husband Paddy's life when on Top Gear
text:
‘I do worry about him’ (Picture: BBC; Getty)

Christine McGuinness has admitted she fears for her husband Paddy’s life when he’s presenting Top Gear.

Take Me Out star Paddy McGuinness took over hosting the show alongside Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris in 2018.

However, his wife Christine has revealed that she worries about him when he’s driving.

The 31-year-old told the Mirror: ‘I do worry about him.

‘When he got it [the job] my first thought was, “Oh my god, I really hope he’s sensible”, because obviously I want him to be careful.’

Speaking at the Best Heroes Awards in Central London, Real Housewives of Cheshire Christine added: ‘I tell him not to go too fast.

‘He’s pretty good at driving. We’ve usually got the kids with us. He’s very sensible, but when he’s on the show he goes back to being a boy in a car. He loves it. It’s his dream job.’

‘I just want him to be sensible’ (Picture: FARRELL / BACKGRID)

And Christine – who shares twins Penelope and Leo, six, and Felicity, three, with Paddy – has reasons to be fearful.

Ex-cricketer Freddie, 41, has already had two accidents on the show.

Although it hasn’t put him off as he was back driving again just days after the second crash, which happened during a drag race.

Paddy started presenting on Top Gear in 2018 (Picture: Ashley Knotek/REX (9940027d)

The cricketer was driving a trike when it veered off the track at Elvington Airfield, near York, at high speed while filming Top Gear.

One witness even said at the time that Freddie ‘is lucky to be alive’.

And how can we forget when former Top Gear host Richard Hammond, 49, was in a coma for two weeks after a 288mph crash.

The near-death accident back in 2006 left Richard with memory loss and unable to recognise his wife, Mindy.

The news also follows after former host Jeremy Clarkson couldn’t help but make a dig at Paddy earlier this week on Who Wants To Be A Millionaire.

The TV presenter quizzed a potential millionaire quizzer on the history of the phrase ‘No Likey, No Lighty’ – which until his move to Top Gear, was Paddy McGuinness’s signature catchphrase from dating show, Take Me Out.

Hopeful Ross Arnett had got to the £1000 question when asked, and clearly was a fan as he managed to get the correct answer quickly.

After the win, Jeremy chucked on his shady glasses for the next question and casually asked: ‘What happened to the host of that…? Disappeared without a trace!’
